name: Watermelon, Feta, and Mint Salad
ingredients: 3 pounds seedless watermelon (about 1 small or 1/4 large)
3 tablespoons (45ml) extra-virgin olive oil, plus more for drizzling
Up to 4 ounces (1 quart) arugula leaves (optional; see note)
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
instructions: Cut watermelon into 1-inch chunks (about 2 pounds/1kg chunks after rind is discarded)
Cut 4 2-inch strips of zest from the lemon
Juice lemon and reserve 1 tablespoon (15ml) juice in a small ramekin
Roughly chop ¼ cup of mint and put in a ramekin
Place watermelon chunks in a large bowl.
Finely chop lemon zest and divide into two bowls.
Add lemon juice,  oil, mint, arugula (if using), and half of zest to bowl with watermelon.and toss until watermelon is evenly dressed
Season lightly to taste with salt and pepper. (The cheese will add saltiness, so go light on the salt at this stage.)
Transfer salad to a wide, shallow bowl or a large plate and spread out evenly.
Drizzle with more olive oil and a few grinds of black pepper.
